sen.j: 探題（たんだい）仏教寺院に置かれた職。
sen.e: "探題"(Tandai)
Tandai （探題） is a position set in a Buddhist temple.
sen.cmt: combined with box below
sen.e: "Tandai" （探題） is a position set in a Buddhist temple.
sen.cmt: 統一リスト（その他 2009/6/29）の指示により、Tandai にダブルクォーテーションを追記しました。

sen.j: 僧の資格を問う論議において、出題に対し出された答えに判定を行う役の僧を言う。
sen.e: Tandai is a Buddhist monk who judged the validity of answers to questions.
The role of a Tandai is a Buddhist monk who judges the validity of answers to questions.
sen.cmt: changed tense
sen.e: The role of a Tandai is a Buddhist monk who judges the validity of answers to questions in the dialogue to examine the qualification as a monk.
sen.cmt: 「僧の資格を問う論議において」訳漏れin the dialogue to examine the qualification as a monk を追記して、訳漏れ対応しました。

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府・室町幕府に置かれた職。
sen.e: The positions set in the Kamakura and Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)
Positions of Tandai set within the Kamakura and Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: The positions→Positions of Tandai
sen.e: Positions of Tandai set within the Kamakura and Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: This will be explained in detail later in this article.
These will be explained in detail at the end of the article.
sen.cmt: fixed for clarity
sen.e: These will be explained in detail in the following sentences.
sen.cmt: These will be explained in detail at the end of the article. をThese will be explained in detail in the following sentences. に修正しました。※ この場合の「本項で」は、「この記事の最後に」ではなく「以下に続く文章で」の方が適切かと思われます。

sen.j: 探題とは、鎌倉幕府や室町幕府において、政務について裁決を行う重要な職をいう。
sen.e: Tandai is an important position set in Kamakura and Muromachi bakufu to make decisions on government affairs such as jurisdiction etc.
Tandai was an important position set within the Kamakura and Muromachi bakufu to make decisions on government affairs.
sen.cmt: eliminated "such as jurisdiction etc" since it is slightly awkward and I cannot find corresponding Japanese words
sen.e: Tandai was an important position set within the Kamakura and Muromachi bakufu to make decisions on government affairs.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: もともと仏教用語で使われていたものを、裁判権など重要な判定を行う職に転用したものか。
sen.e: It is inferred that originally it was used in Buddhist terminology and then came to change its use into meaning the position to make important decision on jurisdiction etc.
It is inferred that tandai was originally used in Buddhist terminology and then converted into a position to make important decisions involving the administration of justice.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar
sen.e: It is inferred that tandai was originally used in Buddhist terminology and then converted into a position to make important decisions involving the administration of justice.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府では執権、連署が探題と呼ばれ、京都や西国に置かれた広範囲な裁判権、軍事指揮権を持つ職に探題の名が与えられた。
sen.e: In Kamakura bakufu, Shikken (shogun regent) and Rensho (associate of Shikken) were called tandai and given the name to the position that had the power of extensive jurisdiction and the right to control the military in Kyoto and Saigoku (western part of Japan, especially Kyushu but ranging as far east as Kinki).

In the Kamakura bakufu, the Shikken (shogun regent) and Rensho (associate of the Shikken) were called tandai, giving them a broad area of jurisdiction in Kyoto and Saigoku (the western part of Japan, especially in Kyushu but ranging as far east as Kinki) and they were given the title as a position which held the right to military control.
sen.cmt: changed sentence structure to correspond closer to the Japanese
sen.e: In the Kamakura bakufu, the Shikken (shogun regent) and Rensho (associate of the Shikken) were called tandai, and the title was given to the position set in Kyoto and Saigoku (the western part of Japan, especially in Kyushu but ranging as far east as Kinki) which had the wide range of rights for jurisdiction and military control.
sen.cmt: 京都や西国に置かれた広範囲な裁判権、軍事指揮権を持つ職に探題の名が与えられたgiving them a broad area of jurisdiction in Kyoto and Saigoku (the western part of Japan, especially in Kyushu but ranging as far east as Kinki) and they were given the title as a position which held the right to military control. をand the title was given to the position set in Kyoto and Saigoku (the western part of Japan, especially in Kyushu but ranging as far east as Kinki) which had the wide range of rights for jurisdiction and military control に修正しました（※）。※ 形容詞句「広範囲な」は、裁判権および軍事指揮権の双方にかかると思われますが、trans2 の訳では裁判権にのみで軍事指揮権にはかかっていないように感じられます。

sen.j: 室町幕府では鎌倉の執権に相当する執事、管領が置かれたがこれらは探題とは呼ばず、奥羽や西国において広範な執行権を持つ職に対して用いられた。
sen.e: In Muromachi bakufu, Shitsuji and Kanrei that were equivalent to Shikken in Kamakura bakufu were set but those positions were not called tandai and the word tandai was used for the position that had extensive executive power in Ou region (northern part of Japan) and Saigoku.

In the Muromachi bakufu, although positions that were equivalent to the Shikken in the Kamakura bakufu were established called Shitsuji and Kanrei, they were not referred to as tandai. Instead, tandai was the title used for the position that held extensive executive power in Saigoku and the Ou region (the northern part of Japan).
sen.cmt: there were too many conjunctions to keep this as one sentence; fixed grammar to read more smoothly
sen.e: In the Muromachi bakufu, although positions called Shitsuji and Kanrei that were equivalent to the Shikken in the Kamakura bakufu were established, they were not referred to as tandai; instead, tandai was the title used for the position that held extensive executive power in Saigoku and the Ou region (the northern part of Japan).
sen.cmt: although positions that were equivalent to the Shikken in the Kamakura bakufu were established called Shitsuji and Kanrei, をalthough positions called Shitsuji and Kanrei that were equivalent to the Shikken in the Kamakura bakufu were established, に修正しました（※）。※ were established called Shitsuji and Kanrei, という語順に若干の違和感を覚えたのですが、修正前の表現はnative speakers にとって自然な表現なのか、判断がつきかねました。they were not referred to as tandai. Instead, をthey were not referred to as tandai; instead, に修正しました。

sen.e: Kamakura Bakufu (shogunate)
Kamakura Bakufu
sen.cmt: "shogunate" not needed here since it is described above
sen.e: The Kamakura Bakufu
sen.cmt: 定冠詞を追記しました。

sen.e: Rensho and Shikken
Rensho and Shikken
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Rensho and Shikken
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto)
Rokuhara Tandai (an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto)
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Rokuhara Tandai (local commissioner in Rokuhara, located in Kyoto)
sen.cmt: 「探題」の説明文を local commissioner in (地名), located in に統一し、an administrative and judicial agency in Rokuhara, Kyoto を local commissioner in Rokuhara, located in Kyoto に修正しました（※）。※地域名によって説明文の訳が異なっていますが、役割は一緒であると判断しました。参考：探題 http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%8E%A2%E9%A1%8C

sen.e: Nagato Tandai (Shogunal deputies in Nagato, a part of western Japan)
Nagato Tandai (Shogunal deputies in Nagato, a part of western Japan)
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Nagato Tandai (local commissioner in Nagato, located in the western part of Japan)
sen.cmt: 「探題」の説明文を local commissioner in (地名), located in に統一し、Shogunal deputies in Nagato, a part of western Japan を local commissioner in Nagato, located in the western part of Japan に修正しました。※地域名によって説明文の訳が異なっていますが、役割は一緒であると判断しました。参考：探題 http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%8E%A2%E9%A1%8C

sen.e: Chinzei Tandai (office of the military governor of Kyushu, the southern part of Japan)
Chinzei Tandai (office of the military governor of Kyushu, the southern part of Japan)
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Chinzei Tandai (local commissioner in Kyushu, located in the southern part of Japan)
sen.cmt: 「探題」の説明文を local commissioner in (地名), located in に統一し、office of the military governor of Kyushu, the southern part of Japan を local commissioner in Kyushu, located in the southern part of Japan に修正しました（※）。※地域名によって説明文の訳が異なっていますが、役割は一緒であると判断しました。参考：探題 http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%8E%A2%E9%A1%8C

sen.e: Muromachi Bakufu (shogunate)
Muromachi Bakufu
sen.cmt: "shogunate" not needed here since it is described above
sen.e: The Muromachi Bakufu
sen.cmt: 定冠詞を追記しました。

sen.e: Oshu Tandai (the local administrative agency of Oshu, a part of northern Japan)
sen.cmt: 厳密には「奥州」は現在の福島、宮城、岩手、青森の４県と秋田県の一部に当ります。
sen.e: Oshu Tandai (the local administration agency of Oshu, a region located in northern Japan)
sen.cmt: fixed grammar
sen.e: Oshu Tandai (local commissioner in Oshu, located in the northern Japan)
sen.cmt: 「探題」の説明文を local commissioner in (地名), located in に統一し、the local administration agency of Oshu, a region located in northern Japan を local commissioner in Oshu, located in the northern Japan に修正しました（※）。※地域名によって説明文の訳が異なっていますが、役割は一緒であると判断しました。参考：探題 http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%8E%A2%E9%A1%8C

sen.e: Ushu Tandai (the administrative agency of Ushu, located in the western part of Oshu)

sen.e: Ushu Tandai (local commissioner in Ushu, located in the western part of Oshu)
sen.cmt: 「探題」の説明文をlocal commissioner に統一し、the administrative agency of を local commissioner in に修正しました（※）。※地域名によって説明文の訳が異なっていますが、役割は一緒であると判断しました。参考：探題 http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%8E%A2%E9%A1%8C

sen.e: Chugoku Tandai or Saigoku Tandai (local commissioner of Chugoku and Saigoku, western part of main island of Japan)
sen.cmt: 中国・西国に対しては定訳が見当たらなかったので「本州の西部」と解釈して英訳しました。

sen.e: Chugoku Tandai or Saigoku Tandai (local commissioner in Chugoku and Saigoku, located in the western part of the main island of Japan)

sen.cmt: 四国については「中国地方の南方の沖」にあると訳を付けました。
